dir-section.heading: Education
dir-section.p: Education, beginning at six years of age, is free and compulsory until the age of 16. Pre-school education is available for children aged between one and six years. Children spend four years at primary school (Grades 1-4), followed by six years at lower secondary school (basic education, Grades 5-10) and two years at upper secondary school or gymnasium (Grades 10-12). Vocational training is available. In 2019/20 enrolment in pre-primary education was equivalent to an estimated 89.0% of children in the relevant age-group. In 2020/21 enrolment in primary schools included 99.7% of pupils (males 99.8%; females 99.7%) in the relevant age-group; enrolment in lower secondary education included 99.9% of those in the relevant age-group, while enrolment in upper secondary education included an estimated 98.8%. In 2021 government spending on education represented 12.7% of total government expenditure.
